results.title: Light illumination and its measurement
results.brief_description: Illustrates the common sources of artificial light and explains their operation. Describes in detail the measurement of light, indicating luminous intensity, luminous flux and illumination. Explains and demonstrates such basic terms as candle power, lumen and foot-candle.

results.title: Light control through polarisation
results.creator_credit: Loucks and Norling Studios and Moviegram Films
results.brief_description: Sketches the nature of light waves, the focusing of a light beam, the spectrum and the use of color filters. Diagrams are employed to explain the theory of polarisation.

results.title: Light and dark
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Art in Action”.
Studies light and shadow, and graduations of color to illustrate the meaning of values in art. Encourages children to find out, by experimentation with light and dark objects, what value is, what it does, and how it makes them feel.

results.title: Light
results.creator_credit: Ivo Burum, ABC-TV (Australia) and Victorian College of Agriculture and Horticulture
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Growing awareness: Factors in plant production”.
Photosynthesis is the process by which a plant converts the energy from sunlight into sugars in specialised cells called chloroplasts. Respiration is the releasing of energy stored in sugars in the parts of the cells called mitochondria. The manipulation of light to simulate the natural habitat, shows how plant science can measure the relationship between light level and growth to determine optimum growing conditions.

results.title: Lifting and carrying
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safetycare”.
Despite rapid and continued advances in mechanisation methods, it will always remain impossible to eliminate physical involvement within the working environment. Material handling occurs in one way or another in every department of every business on every working day, so it is not surprising that accidents resulting from incorrect handling techniques comprise nearly 30% of occupational injuries, with the most common injury being back pain. This video and trainer’s manual highlights the construction of the spine and its limitations and clearly illustrates how and why injuries will occur if we do not respect the limitations and use correct lifting and carrying techniques.

results.title: Lifesaving
results.brief_description: This film demonstrates the swimming strokes best adapted to life-saving: how to approach a swimmer in difficulties, breaking holds, carries, methods of rescuing by boat and by ring buoy, and the Schafer method of resuscitation.

results.title: Lifesaving
results.brief_description: This film, which includes a demonstration of land drill by the Southsea Police Lifeguard Corps (England), shows in detail the various methods needed for rescuing a docile person, a turbulent person, somebody really violent, and a tired but clear-headed swimmer. The sidestroke method of rescue, the surface dive necessary if the subject has sunk, and the use of artificial respiration are also demonstrated.

results.title: Lifeclimb
results.creator_credit: Stan Zundell, Pyramid Films and Stan Zundell Productions
results.brief_description: A documentary in which 64 year old Stan Zundell describes the manner in which he has faced the difficulties and challenges of aging. Shows how he continually challenges himself with rigorous physical activity, increasing his abilities as he struggles to achieve his goals.

results.title: Life story of the paramecium
results.creator_credit: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: The physical characteristics, life functions, adaptation to environment and means of reproduction of the paramecium, a one-celled animal or protozoa which performs all life functions in a single cell. Some, the volvox, live in colonies and perform special functions, making it possible for new organisms to develop and function. An understanding of the protozoa provides the basis for a better understanding of the functions of all animals.
